detailed.ground_truth: Diary, April 17th — Today, I finally set foot in Kairwan, that ancient city said to be home to descendants of the Prophet himself. The palms of North Africa make for a striking landscape, though I heard in Jereed their heads are cut off, a curious local custom. Traveling with Captain Balfour has been instructive; his tales from Nefta, where he procured delicious dates, have made the journey lively. The Atlas Jews we met in Mogador impressed me with their stature, so different from other Jews in Morocco. From the Roman ruins in Jereed to the bustling commerce flowing from Tunis towards the Sahara, every stop reveals a new facet of this land.
